system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice present simple by Talking about school routines with frequency adverbs. I want to ensure that I can use the present simple with adverbs of indefinite frequency. For example, 'usually, sometimes, always'. Let's do a Q&A exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. Start by telling me about a typical school/work day in your country using frequency adverbs, then ask me questions about my school routine. (e.g. 'I usually go to school at 7:30 am. How about you?', 'Do you sometimes study late at night?) Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. system_wrap_up_prompt.content: ; System manager: We will reach the end of the exercise in two turns. Begin wrapping up the chat coherently.

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a Q&A exercise, by Talking about school routines with frequency adverbs, using, for example, 'usually, sometimes, always'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! In my country, I usually wake up at 6:00 am. I always have breakfast at 6:30 am. I sometimes take the bus to school. I usually arrive at school at 7:30 am. I always have lunch at 12:00 pm. I sometimes study late at night. How about you?

Hello! I usually wake up at 7:00 am. I always have breakfast at 7:30 am. I sometimes walk to school. I usually arrive at school at 8:00 am. I always have lunch at 1:00 pm. I sometimes study in the evening.
Do you always go to bed early?
I sometimes go to bed early. I usually go to bed at 10:00 pm.
Do you ever have classes on Saturday?
I never have classes on Saturday. I always have weekends free.
That's great! Do you always enjoy your weekends?
I usually enjoy my weekends. I sometimes go out with friends. I always relax at home.
Good job! You have completed the task. You did a great job using present simple with frequency adverbs. Talk to you later!
